decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - 4.	The development hereby permitted shall be begun either before the expiration of (five) years from the date of this permission, or before the expiration of (two) years from the date of approval of the last of the reserved matters to be approved, whichever is the later.    
(Reason.  To accord with the provisions of Section 92(1) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990)

Condition : 2 - 1.	Approval of the details of the design and external appearance of the building(s),  and the landscaping of the site (hereinafter called "the reserved matters") shall be obtained from the local planning authority in writing before any development is commenced
(Reason.  To accord with the provisions of Section 92(1) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990)

Condition : 3 - 2.	Plans and particulars of the reserved matters referred to in condition 2 above, relating to the design and external appearance of any buildings to be erected and the landscaping of the site, shall be submitted in writing to the local planning authority and shall be carried out as approved.
(Reason.  To accord with the provisions of Section 92(1) of the Town and Country  Planning Act 1990)

Condition : 4 - 3.	Application for approval of the reserved matters shall be made to the local planning authority before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
(Reason.  To accord with the provisions of Section 92(1) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990)
Condition : 5 - No deliveries shall be taken at or despatched from the site outside the hours of 0800 to 1800 hours nor at any time on Saturdays, Sundays, Bank or Public Holidays.

Condition : 6 - 9.	No dwelling shall be occupied until a means of vehicular access has been constructed in accordance with the approved plans
      (Reason.  In the interests of road safety)

Condition : 7 - No dwelling shall be occupied until the acces and space in front of the dwellings has been laid out within the site in accordance with the drawing number SD 027E for cars to be parked and to turn so that they may enter and leave the site in forward gear. These spaces shall thereafter be retained solely for that purpose

Condition : 8 - No dwelling shall be occupied until two vehicle parking spaces have been laid out within each of the areas of retained garden at Nos 27 and 29 Heldman Close as shown on Plan SD 027E and they shall thereafter be retained for that purpose.

Condition : 9 - No development shall take place until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details

Condition : 10 - No development shall take place until details of the site lighting during construction have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local Planning Authority and the scheme shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details

Condition : 11 - No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a scheme of landscaping, which shall include indications of all exisitng trees and hedgerows on the land, and details of any to be retained, together with measures for their protection in the course of development. The scheme shall include in particular details of the boundary treatemnts and of the landscaping to be provided adjoining  the retained rear gardens of Nos 27 and 29 Heldman Close
Condition : 12 - All hard and soft landscape works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details including the programme agreed with the Local Planning Authority

Condition : 13 - No development shall take place until details of the measures to avoid mud or dust or other loose materials being carried onto the highway or blowing into the surrounding gardens have been submitted to anmd approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority
description: Erection of two 2-storey 2-bedroom semi-detached dwellinghouses in rear gardens of existing dwellings incoporating details of siting and access. (Outline Application - Amended Description).
